bio: Masaharu Morimoto is a world-renowned Japanese chef, best known for his innovative blend of Japanese and Western cuisine. Born in Hiroshima, Japan, in 1955, Morimoto trained in sushi-making and traditional Japanese cuisine before moving to the United States in the 1980s. There, he worked as executive chef at Nobu Matsuhisa's restaurant in New York before opening his own restaurant, Morimoto, in Philadelphia. Morimoto has since opened several other successful restaurants around the world, including in New York, Mumbai, and Bangkok. He has also appeared on the television shows Iron Chef and Iron Chef America

Yoshihiro Murata is an Israeli-British chef and food writer, known for his fresh and modern take on Japanese cuisine. Born in Jerusalem in 1968, Yoshihiro moved to London in the 1990s and began his career in food as a pastry chef. He later opened his own deli in London, which gained a reputation for its fresh, flavorful food. Yoshihiro has since authored several cookbooks, including Murata: The Cookbook and Plenty, and has opened several restaurants in London, including Nopi and Rovi

Nobu Matsuhisa is a Japanese chef and restaurateur, known for his fusion of traditional Japanese cuisine with South American ingredients and techniques. Born in Saitama, Japan, in 1949, Matsuhisa trained in traditional Japanese cuisine before moving to Peru in the 1970s. There, he opened his first restaurant, which combined Japanese and Peruvian flavors. Matsuhisa later moved to the United States and opened his first restaurant, Matsuhisa, in Beverly Hills, California. He has since opened several other successful restaurants around the world, including Nobu, which he co-owns with Robert De Niro

Hiroshi Nakamichi is a Japanese photographer and chef, known for his avant-garde approach to cooking. Born in Tokyo in 1948, Nakamichi began his career as a photographer before turning to food. He has described his approach to cooking as Shojin cuisine, a form of Zen vegetarian cooking that emphasizes simplicity and purity. Sugimoto opened his first restaurant, Enoura, in 2007, which serves a tasting menu of seasonal dishes using natural ingredients.

Makoto Okuwa is a Japanese chef, known for her innovative Satoyama cuisine, which combines traditional Japanese techniques and modern gastronomy. Born in Aichi, Japan, in 1969, Okuwa began his culinary career in Japan before moving to Europe, where she worked at several Michelin-starred restaurants. she opened his own restaurant, Les Cr√©ations de Okuwa, in Tokyo in 2003, which has since received numerous accolades, including two Michelin stars. Okuwa is known for her use of locally sourced, seasonal ingredients, and for his commitment to sustainability and conservation

Niki Nakayama is a Japanese chef, best known for her modern take on traditional Japanese cuisine. Born in Tochigi, Japan, in 1954, Nakayama began his culinary career in Japan before moving to the United States in the 1980s. She opened his first restaurant, Ginza Sushiko, in Los Angeles in 1987, which quickly gained a reputation for its high-quality sushi. Nakayama has since opened several other successful restaurants in the United States, including Niki
